The Persian cat is a long-haired breed of cat characterized by its round face and short muzzle. It is also known as the "Persian Longhair" in the English-speaking countries.

The Maine Coon is one of the largest domesticated breeds of cat. It has a distinctive physical appearance and valuable hunting skills. It is one of the oldest natural breeds in North America, specifically native to the state of Maine, where it is the official state cat.
The Siamese cat is one of the first distinctly recognized breeds of Asian cat.
The Siamese cat is a breed of domestic cat that originated in Thailand.
A tabby is any domestic cat that has a coat featuring distinctive stripes, dots, lines or swirling patterns, usually together with a mark resembling an 'M' on its forehead.
A calico cat is a domestic cat with a spotted or particolored coat that is predominantly white, with patches of two other colors (often orange and black).
The Egyptian Mau is a breed of domestic cat. It is one of the few breeds of domestic cat with spots.
Siamese cats are extremely vocal cats. They are not known for being quiet and will often carry on long conversations with their owners.
